name: 2-(2-chlorophenoxy)ethylamine
Reason: 2-(2-chlorophenoxy)ethylamine is a compound with a chlorophenoxy group attached to an ethylamine group. The chlorophenoxy group is a polar functional group that can participate in hydrogen bonding, which will increase the melting point compared to a simple alkylamine. The ethylamine group is a basic amine that can form hydrogen bonds with water, but the presence of the chlorophenoxy group will dominate the melting point behavior. The chlorophenoxy group is similar to a phenol, which has a melting point of 41°C. The addition of the chlorine atom will increase the melting point by approximately +10°C due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The ethylamine group will contribute a small increase in melting point due to its polar nature, but the overall melting point will be dominated by the chlorophenoxy group.
